title: Gastric Cancer Expert System
description: A Mamdani-type fuzzy inference system developed in MATLAB to estimate the risk of gastric cancer. It incorporates 67 expert-defined rules and evaluates 13 clinically relevant risk factors including dietary habits, smoking, family history, and Helicobacter pylori infection. The system offers early detection insights by categorizing patients into Low, Moderate, or High risk groups.

title: Diabetes Expert System
description: A hybrid machine learning system trained on the Diabetes Prediction Dataset from Kaggle. The model integrates logistic regression with feature engineering and one-hot encoding for categorical variables. It predicts diabetes risk using key health indicators such as HbA1c, BMI, blood glucose, and medical history. Performance is benchmarked for high clinical relevance.

title: Heart Disease Expert System
description: This machine learning-based heart disease prediction system leverages XGBoost, a robust gradient boosting algorithm. It has been trained using the UCI Cleveland dataset with hyperparameter tuning and feature scaling to ensure high performance and reliability. The model is designed to support binary classification for clinical decision-making and includes output metrics like accuracy and classification reports.
